pr_title: Implement jdbc methods invoked by Calcite

timeline.author: thejasmn

timeline.bodyText:
HIVE_DEFAULT_NULLS_LAST could be overridden on the HiveServer2 using hive-site.xml settings. We need to get a value of this from HS2.
I am not sure if we get the current settings from HS2 (i need to check).
timeline.author: thejasmn

replies.bodyText: In Beeline we pick the Hive config and prefix it with hiveconf: and put it in the JDBCParameters.hiveConf. So, I have added the prefix, while looking up for the relevant key in the map. Not sure if there is any other place, where we send the hive conf differently.
replies.author: kishendas

replies.bodyText: I think @thejasmn concern is valid. If user specifies the property value in the connection parameters, then we will retrieve it here. However, if it is not present, we probably need to establish a connection to HS2 to retrieve the parameter value, since it may not be necessarily the default?
replies.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText:
@jcamachor @thejasmn Looks like we already open the session with HS2 in HiveConnection, but when I see the OpenSession implementation in ThriftCLIService, looks like we only send one HiveConf configuration :
resp.setConfiguration(Collections
.singletonMap(HiveConf.ConfVars.HIVE_SERVER2_THRIFT_RESULTSET_DEFAULT_FETCH_SIZE.varname,
Integer.toString(fetchSize))); Should I add HIVE_DEFAULT_NULLS_LAST here or we need to expose a new method ?
replies.author: kishendas

replies.bodyText: @kishendas , I think it makes sense to return that property value too when the session is open since the mechanism is already in place and adding an additional property value should not create much overhead.
replies.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText: @jcamachor @thejasmn Please check if the changes look good.
replies.author: kishendas

replies.bodyText: New code makes sense to me. @thejasmn could you take a quick look in case I am missing anything?
replies.author: jcamachor

timeline.bodyText: An unit test would be useful for nullsAreSortedHigh and nullsAreSortedLow
timeline.author: thejasmn

timeline.bodyText: Can you also please test for value of true ? That way it checks that method return value is changing based on the config param value.
timeline.author: thejasmn

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't this be the opposite, i.e., isn't hive.default.nulls.last same as nullsAreSortedHigh?
Whether to set NULLS LAST as the default null ordering for ASC order.
timeline.author: jcamachor

timeline.bodyText:
The setting in client side should override the server settings. ie, server setting should be used if no such value is set in the client side
Can we make this generic ? Ie, loop through all the server settings and set it in hiveConfs only if there is no value set currently ?
timeline.author: thejasmn

timeline.bodyText: This if statement should never return false. Something is wrong if it does, we should throw an error in that case (otherwise, we might run into some harder to debug issues).
timeline.author: thejasmn

replies.bodyText: I think there can be JDBC tests where hiveConf can come as null. I can change this and see how many tests fail.
replies.author: kishendas

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a test to verify we are getting the config value from server ? Either in TestHiveDatabaseMetaData or a different test ?
timeline.author: thejasmn

replies.bodyText: Sure, I will look into this.
replies.author: kishendas

replies.bodyText: Updated the existing test case TestThriftCliServiceWithInfoMessage.java for this. Please take a look, when you get time.
replies.author: kishendas
